result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation by 4:00 PM on Friday, September 12, 2014.
Defendant may be released from Probation after 12 months if all conditions have been met.

miscConds.notes:
$200.00 cash bond applied.
Court costs to be paid within 60 days.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless specifically prescribed to her and taken as prescribed.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

miscConds.notes: Court costs to be paid within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Carlson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda L Carlson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 14CF171 AND 14CT143.
Agreement.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.

Court questions defendant.  
14CF171:  State moves to amend Count 1 to 948.21(1)(a) Class A Misdemeanor - neglect of child.  Court grants.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as amended.  Court accepts and finds guilty.  
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 3 - Class B Misdemeanor.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.  
Court orders Count 2 DRI.

14CT143: State moves to amend to no valid driver's license on person 343.18(1).  Court grants.  Defendant pleads Guilty as amended.  Court accepts and finds guilty.  

State agrees with recommendation.
Attorney Raymond relates and agrees with recommendation.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
14CT143: $267.50 forfeiture - 60 DTP.  May set up payment plan.

14CF171:  Withheld on both counts
Probation - 2 years.  If after 12 months all conditions met, can be released from probation.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Must take no controlled substances unless prescribed and as prescribed.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court Costs - 60 DTP.

Must report to Probation by 4:00 p.m. Friday, September 12, 2014.

Defendant Amanda L Carlson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 14CF171 AND 14CT143.
Reset.
  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must have no contact with A.M.H. d.o.b. 3/16/98.
No abusive contact with Noah C.

6-19-2014   BOND AMENDED TO ALLOW CONTACT WITH A.M.H. dob 3-16-98  FOR FAMILY COUNSELING SESSIONS AND CONTACT THROUGH A THIRD PARTY TO SET UP FAMILY COUNSELING SESSIONS. 

ALL OTHER CONDITIONS TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

MODIFIED 7/7/14 TO NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH A.M.H., D.O.B. 3/16/98.  ALL OTHER DONCITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Amanda L Carlson in court with attorney Ryan J Raymond.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 14CF171 AND 14CT143. 
14CF171: Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG to all counts. Defense makes bond modification request. Bond modified in 14CF171. State does not object. Bond modified to "no abusive contact with A.M.H." 


Both cases reset for 8/27/14 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must have no contact with A.M.H. d.o.b. 3/16/98.
No abusive contact with Noah C.

ALL OTHER CONDITIONS TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Amanda L Carlson in court with attorney Ryan J Raymond.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COVERS 14CF171 and 14CT143

14CF171: 
Defendant waives Preliminary Hearing. Court questions and accepts waiver. 
Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for trial. 

Defense requests bond modification to amend from no contact to no abusive contact with AMH. State does not object. 
Court grants bond modification to allow for contact with AMH for family counseling sessions and contact through a third party to set up family counseling sessions.  

14CT143 to continue to track. 

Arraignment scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

No abusive contact with Noah C.

Defendant Amanda L Carlson in court with attorney John G Hinde.  Defendant Amanda L Carlson in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waives time limits for preliminary examination.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
